6: I love rock and roll music.  Do you know much about the genre?

do you see the color red in nature a lot ?

Well, for example, you'll see red in the sky at times due to the Rayleigh scattering, and you'll see red in the Grand Canyon and other geological features because of hematite or red ochre, which come from iron oxide. These are just a couple of examples, but red is very present in nature.

Another couple of interesting examples of red... one notable galactic example is Mars, which is also red because of iron oxide. And then there's your own blood! It's red from the hemoglobin protein in it. Anthocyanins give the red color to strawberries, red apples, and red autumn leaves.. Red is all around us, in little details of our lives.
